page.title: 06Shoreham Airport
page.content: St Nicholas Church is of Saxon origin.The old Toll Bridge dates back to the 18th century.It is closed to horses and invalid carriages due to restoration work. Shoreham airport was one of the first flying fields in the country. Today it is the only one still operating as a public licensed aerodrome.The airport has year round scheduled services to France and Channel Isles. The airport is owned and operated by Brighton, Hove and Worthing Joint Municipal Airport Comittee. There are 100 aircraft and 25 helicopters there. The airport has 3 runways, 2 grass 1 hard. The airport covers 93 hectares of land. There are 4 flying schools operating there. It cannot expand as it is bounded by physical features on 4 sides, the A 27, the river Adur, the railway line and Lancing village.
